newsitem.title: FRANCE: Rennes say Jan-Aug cargo traffic rises 28.5 pct.
newsitem.headline: Rennes say Jan-Aug cargo traffic rises 28.5 pct.

text.p: Rennes-St Jacques airport handled 2,126 tonnes of air cargo and trucked airfreight in the first eight months of 1996, an increase of 28.5 percent on 1995 levels, airport authority figures show.
Air cargo volume totalled 1,947 tonnes, up 33.3 percent on January-August 1995.
Rennes sole "all-cargo" flight is a nightly service operated by Air Jet, the airline subsidiary of French air and road express distribution group, Jet Services.
Rennes features as a stopover on Air Jet's British Aerospace BAe146QC (quick change) cargo service whose full itinerary reads: Paris/CDG-Strasbourg-Montpellier-Rennes-Marseille-Paris/CDG.
The Air Jet service handled 1,858 tonnes of airfreight between January and August, up 55 percent on 1995 levels.
French airlines -- Air France Europe, Brit Air, Regional Airlines and Flandre Air operate passenger services from Rennes airport.
Trucked airfreight handled at the airport totalled 178 tonnes, down 8.1 percent on the first eight months of 1995.
January-August 1996 postal traffic handled at Rennes airport totalled 3,112 tonnes, up 13.5 percent on the same period last year.

French airline, L'Aeropostale, carries overnight mail between its Paris-Charles de Gaulle hub and Rennes on a regular basis using a Boeing 737QC aircraft. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
